text: Bottle, many thanks Werckmeister! Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is pure natural passion fruit, a touch phenolic and wheat - and I love passion fruit. Taste is wheat, phenols, straw, mineralic, dry finish. Medium carbonation. A bit green in the taste, but the aroma is absolutely lovely. Super refreshing. Great stuff, despite the slightly disappointing flavour after the perfect aroma.

Cloudy yellow with little white head. Aroma is passion fruit mango. So fruity. Damn. Slight wheat. Taste is green leek yeasts. Quite sour. A bit fruity sweetness as well. Medium body. Finish is quite fruity again. Fresh. Interesting. Nice aroma.

(bottle) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy passion fruit and vanilla icing, slightly phenolic, with lots of cheesecake, some prickly pear and raspberries. flavour is mostly kiwi, herbal hops and wheat, again rather phenolic, with some more passion fruit, peanut husks and a prickly semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy neon yellow, white lace. Tropical aromatics, clear passion fruit, nice tartness. Medium light body, slightly earthy dry, great fruitiness. Not a fan of the dry mineral and extra phenolic notes.

Just amazing. Only available on tap. Tried on various occasions over multiple cans and months. Exotic passion fruit flavores wheat beer even my girlfriend who doesnt like beer at all enjoys a lot. Would buy and drink 365 days a year.

On Tap. Weird bubbly carbonation, very litte to no head for a wheat. Seems off. Very dry, almost cidery, apple-like flavours. Some passionfruit is apparent. Very thin body, almost tart finish. Not your typical Wheat.

Tap. Cloudy pale yellow body with large lasting white head. Aroma is tropical fruits wheat and some citrus. Taste is sour malty with some fruits and resin in the background. Aftertaste is slight sourness with hints of bitterness.

Draught at Craft Bier Fest Wien: Milky yellow color, light creamy white head. Aroma with tropical fruits (citrus peel, lychee), some wheat yeast notes. Flavor is quite similar, mainly citrus, citrus peel, lychee. Nice stuff, a real tropical wheat.
From tap. Fine head, cloudy yellow color, pure passion fruit aroma, good carbonication. Great beer- one of my favorite!

Tap from Beer Store Vienna. Its amazing what passionfruit can do to a German hefeweizen. The aroma of this beer is pure passionfruit. I was looking for any hints of bananas which is characteristic of German hefeweizens, but nada, thats gone. But thats not necessarily a bad thing, because the mere introduction of the passionfruit birthed something new. Now I feel like Im drinking a fusion of a gose with some mild wheat beer and a very aromatic passionfruit that rules them both. Quite fascinating. Overall, the beer is quite citrusy, refreshing and dry and would work very well with greasy food.

Sampled from tap at Beer Store Vienna.
Orange, hazy body, with a massive, frothy, rocky, strongly lacing, white head.
Very fruity aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, dried fruits, wild berries, banana, wheat, bread, subtle spices.
Tastes of citrus, wheat, banana, spices, bread, passion fruit, some berries.
Medium to light, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes citric, spicy, medium yeasty, medium fruity, a bit bready.

Tasty. Drinks very easy and fresh, while its very aromatic at the same time. Especially the nose is really lovely, bursting with various fruit notes. Perfect summer beer, among my favourite beers by this brewery so far.

From tap. Cloudy straw yellow with a white head. Fruity aroma of passion fruit along with some yeast. The taste is dominated by a fruity sourness - passion fruit and citric fruits. Very refreshing nice brew.

0,5l from tap at Ottakringer Braukulturwochen shared by a friend. yellow cloudy colour, small white head. very nice fruity smell, passion fruit, light resin, berry, light yeast. very nice fruity smell. light body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of passion fruit, yeasty, light herbal, stone lemon grass. finishes lightly bitter with notes of passion fruit, yeast notes and herbal notes. very nice one, lovely combination of fruity, (belgian) yeasty and light herbal notes. lovely beer.

From tap at Ottakringer Braukulturwochen. Cloudy, small white head. Very fruity aroma, mainly passion fruit, but also hints of banana. The lively carbonation and the decent acidity from the passion fruit add up to a very refreshing wheat beer. I really hope that this becomes one of the breweries regular beers.
